intro: Crotalaria verdcourtii, commonly known as the African bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. It produces small, spherical seed pods that contain a single, hard-seeded fruit. Crotalaria verdcourtii is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
